meta.title: Binomial Distribution
binom.title: Binomial Distribution
binom.section1.title: 1. Definition and Interpretation
binom.section1.intro: The Binomial distribution models the number of successes in n independent Bernoulli trials with success probability p.
binom.section1.scenarios: Commonly used in quality control, clinical trials, and coin-flip style experiments.
binom.section1.rel1: Special case: when n=1, it reduces to the Bernoulli distribution.
binom.section1.rel2: Closely related to the Normal and Poisson distributions via approximations.
binom.section2.title: 2. Analytical Forms
binom.section3.title: 3. Graphs
binom.section4.title: 4. Additional Notes
binom.section4.usage: Used to model counts of successes in repeated independent experiments.
binom.section5.title: 5. Functions in R
binom.section5.desc: Common R calls for the Binomial distribution:
binom.section5.code:
## PMF
dbinom(k, size=n, prob=p)

## CDF
pbinom(k, size=n, prob=p)

## Quantile (inverse CDF)
qbinom(q, size=n, prob=p)

## Random generation
rbinom(n_samples, size=n, prob=p)
binom.section5.paramNote: Parameters: size = n, prob = p; functions are vectorized in k (or q).
